issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

I was noticing some buggy behavior in an app I'm building. I decided to distill the bug down to this:

Setup
1. Create a new project
2. Add app.js & description.js (source code can be found here: http://gist.github.com/371540)
3. Run on the device

View the bug
1. Click on the table row
2. Type anything, click 'Done' button
3. Click on the table row
4. DON'T TYPE ANYTHING
5. Click on the 'Cancel' button
6. Watch it crash

I would appreciate any and all advice on the matter.

{html}
fields.summary: Back button causes app to crash
